glsa.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache.

background.p: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.

description.p: Adrian Pastor and Amir Azam (ProCheckUp) reported that the HTTP Method specifier header is not properly sanitized when the HTTP return code is "413 Request Entity too large" (CVE-2007-6203). The mod_proxy_balancer module does not properly check the balancer name before using it (CVE-2007-6422). The mod_proxy_ftp does not define a charset in its answers (CVE-2008-0005). Stefano Di Paola (Minded Security) reported that filenames are not properly sanitized within the mod_negotiation module (CVE-2008-0455, CVE-2008-0456).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a malicious URL or send specially crafted HTTP requests (i.e using Adobe Flash) to perform Cross-Site Scripting and HTTP response splitting attacks, or conduct a Denial of Service attack on the vulnerable web server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Apache users should upgrade to the latest version:
